input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: MSSCCMActor.

Sample items Xml:
Items xml to delete some specific membership rules of a collection-
<items> <item> <target>config1</target> <collection-id>SMS00003</collection-id> <rule-name>rule name</rule-name> <limit-to-collection-id>SMSDM003</limit-to-collection-id> </item> </items>
Items xml to delete all the membership rules of a collection-
<items> <item> <target>config1</target> <collection-id>SMS00003</collection-id> <all/> </item> </items>
Elements' Description:
item [Required] This is a child tag of <items> tag. The <item> tag can be specified multiple times to support "multiple items support".
target [Optional]: This element to specify the connection information for the Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager application.
Valid values: The value specified for <target> XML element must be same as the value that has been specified for the name attribute of <config> element in Grid Manager adapter configuration.
Default value: If this element is not provided or left empty, the request will be executed on the first defined Grid Manager adapter configuration.
Note: The value of this tag is case sensitive.
collection-id [Required] ID of the collection whose membership rule is to be deleted.
all [Optional] It is an empty tag. It doesn't contain any value. If this tag is present in <item> tag then all the membership rules of the collection are deleted irrespective of the presence of the other tags.
Note: <all> takes precedence on other tags.
rule-name [Optional] Name of the membership rule to be deleted.
limit-to-collection-id [Optional] Specifies the value of the “limit-to-collection-id” field of the membership rule to be deleted.

output.description: Returned adapter response is captured in this context parameter.

documentation.description:
Delete Membership Rule From Collection
This wrapper deletes Membership Rule from collection. This process is equivalent to removing a rule of "Query" type from the collection.
